title: "influencer-marketing-analysis"
output: html_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(dplyr)
library(readr)

age_levels <- c(
  "18-25", 
  "26-35"
)

education_levels <- c(
  "Senior high school degree or equivalent",
  "Bachelor's degree",                     
  "Master's degree or higher"              
)

frenquency_levels <-c(
  "Less than once a month",
  "About once a month",
  "About once a week",
  "About two to three times a week",
  "About once a day",
  "More than once a day" 
)

likert_levels <- c(
  "Not likely at all",
  "Slightly likely",   
  "Moderately Likely",
  "Very likely"       
)

d_dataframe <- read_csv(
  './data/influencer-marketing-data.csv',
  col_types = cols(
    col_factor(),
    col_factor(ordered = TRUE, levels = age_levels),
    col_factor(ordered = TRUE, levels = education_levels),
    col_factor(ordered = TRUE, levels = frenquency_levels),
    col_factor(ordered = TRUE, levels = likert_levels),
    col_factor(ordered = TRUE, levels = likert_levels),
    
  ))
```


```{r}
library(ggplot2)

d_dataframe %>%
  ggplot(aes(
    x = gender
  )) + geom_bar()

d_dataframe %>%
  ggplot(aes(
    x = age
  )) + geom_bar()

d_dataframe %>%
  ggplot(aes(
    x = education
  )) + geom_bar()+coord_flip()


d_dataframe %>%
  ggplot(aes(
    x = frequency
  )) + geom_bar()+coord_flip()

```

```{r}
d_dataframe_1 <- d_dataframe %>%
  mutate(
    informativeness = as.numeric(informativeness),
    entertainment = as.numeric(entertainment)
    )%>%
  cor.test(~ informativeness + entertainment, method = 'spearman', data = .)

```
